Text.Value: No mercy. Kill the goblin.
Leave.
*The veil of rage wavers. Your blood seems to cool in your veins.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian's expression softens as they overcome their battle rage.

Text.Value: No, wait!

EditorData.NodeContext: A final desperate cry (he's killed by the player immediately after this).

Text.Value: *The goblin's snivelling makes your blood boil. You could give in to the rage and end the wicked little maggot in one strike...*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian player glowers murderously at Fezzerk

Text.Value: I want everything of value you have.
You sure I c-can't just leave?
A-all right, fine. Take it - take it all! Now... can I go...?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Fezzerk hands over whatever gold the player previously gave him. Can occur out of frame/inventory transfer.
EditorData.NodeContext: Desperate. He'll say yes to anything in order to save his hide.

Text.Value: There's a hidden path, p-past the bridge into the camp. Over to the side before you reach the first guards. Easy.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

Text.Value: *...but perhaps he knows something useful? Your head aches as rage fights against reason.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian player glowers murderously at Fezzerk

Text.Value: All right! Just don't 'urt me!
Give in. KILL THE MAGGOT.
Leave reason to the reasonable. Kill the runt.
Th-thanks! And 'pologies. And... erm... bye!

EditorData.NodeContext: Surprise. He's being left off the hook. He stammers out an acknowledgement before making a swift exit.

Text.Value: W-well, what do you say?
A-all right, fine. Take it - take... Wait. It's... it's gone!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Fezzerk hands over whatever gold the player previously gave him. Can occur out of frame/inventory transfer.
EditorData.NodeContext: Desperate.Realises that the gold he was going to bargain for his life is missing.

Text.Value: Give me my gold back - and anything else you have, too.
Talk and you might live. If it's worth my while.
I want the gold you took. Now.
M-my lot are camped nearby - I can get you inside, no hassle! You can loot it, do whatever!

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

Text.Value: Stop! I give up! M-mercy, please!

EditorData.NodeContext: Desperate, grovelling. He's throwing in the towel as he's on the verge of losing a fight.

Text.Value: Your valuables are mine now. Hand them over.
Your valuables - now.
Ignore the rage. Listen to your head. There is nothing to gain from being rash.
I know things. If you let me live, I'll make it worth your while. I p-promise!
*It's no use. Your body seems to have a mind of its own as you move to strike the goblin dead.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian's glowering gets more intense as they move to strike fezzerk

Text.Value: Run along, goblin. Before I change my mind.

Synopsis: After being defeated in combat, a goblin named Fezzerk begs for mercy from the player. He tries to bargain for his life. The player can let him go or kill him. This dialogue takes place somewhere away from the windmill where Fezzerk was tormenting Barcus Wroot.
